results.title: Operation Blue Whale
results.brief_description: On May 5th 1992 a dead nineteen metre Blue whale was washed ashore on the South Coast of Victoria. This video documents the challenges faced by the Museum of Victoria in retrieving the carcass, and the preparation of the skeleton for permanent exhibition at the Museum. Photography, music and narration by Dr David Smith. Rights held by Dr David Smith.

results.title: Kakadu
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, Bob Lagettie, Norm Wilkinson and Chateau Productions
results.brief_description: This is a well-made documentary about Kakadu National Park, with beautiful photography of the amazing landscape. Narrated by Jack Thompson, the film gives a fascinating account of the natural history of the area, including the flora and fauna, as well as the Aboriginal history Of equal interest, the film discusses the history of the Park, which was created at the same time as the adjacent Ranger Nuclear Mine began construction. Kakadu is rich in natural wonders, in Aboriginal history and, on the other hand, in mineral resources attractive to mining companies, which makes it one of the world’s unique sites.

results.title: Shelter
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Wallhead and Vagabond Motion Picture Film Production Unit
results.brief_description:
A disturbed young man, frightened by the threat of nuclear war, wanders the streets in search of safety.

The film was shot on the city streets of Perth, Western Australia.

results.title: Private eye
results.creator_credit: Geoff Tyson, Peter McKinley, Tasmania Dept. of Labour and Industry and Tasfilm Productions
results.brief_description:
This 1970 film demonstrates the importance of eye safety and shows various methods of protection. The film opens with a sequence in film noir style of a ‘private eye’ working a case, with this gimmick interspersed throughout the film. It shows industrial working scenarios and various examples of eye protection, including safety glasses and helmets with visors.

Produced by Tasfilm Productions for the Department of Labour and Industry, Tasmania, and presented by Protector Sureguard.

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: It's up to us
results.brief_description: The Intellectual Disability Rights service have produced this video to help disabled people to deal with rights and responsibilities at work. It includes issues such as safety, sexual harrassment, the right to be treated fairly, the right to choose your own friends and to have relationships. The second section looks at why people may want a workers committee and how one group of workers set one up.

results.title: The Bad society
results.brief_description: In December 1976, 16,000 people converged at the Cotter River in Canberra for the “Down to earth” festival; a conference on alternative lifestyles. In attendance were Reverend George Davies, Dr. Jim Cairns, Dr. Jim Falk as well as thousands of counter culture followers. This documentary explores the festival and the themes of politics and social change. The Philisophy of Ex Deputy Prime Minister, Dr. Jim Cairns is particularly focussed on with its emphasis on how a nation state creates a ‘bad society’ and how communal life and a counter culture lifestyle forms the only radicalism against society.
